ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, this course is essential for any aspiring Hebrew Bible student.

I would summarize the class as a good overview of the historical critical project in Old Testament studies. I think any Hebrew Bible student at YDS would be doing themselves a disservice by avoiding it.I would recommend students plan their semester around this course and its heavy work-load. The majority of my work this semester was spent preparing for the week-to-week demands of this class, and while the pay-off was well worth it, a student taking the class with other difficult classes would have a very hard time.
It is a good introduction to Hebrew Bible scholarship, if you are willing to complete the considerable workload. It's an important class to take if you plan to continue in this field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel like after this course I have a much better understanding of the field, and the scholars who have come before me.
This course has helped me in deciding and narrowing my particular interests and getting a better understanding of the field of OT study.
